item.title: Three drains on the floor, 2nd December

I there are higher then pavement fell over ! Hurt my self it dangerous!!! conversation needs to be have and I would like some compensation so much pain

item.title: Several Lime bikes dumped in the middle of the pavement, 2nd December
item.description:
Several Lime bikes have been dumped on the footpath outside Boots. They are lying on their sides in a tangled pile. This is clearly not only antisocial but it is also dangerous to all pedestrians, whether fit, disabled, frail, partially sighted, et al.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Greenwich Church Street, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street cleaning Fletching Road has not been cleaned for some days now the entire street is covered with slippery leaves making it dangerous for pedestrians to use., 2nd December
item.description:

item.title: Balloons still in tree 6 months later, 2nd December
item.description:
These balloons have been stuck in the tree and wrapped around a telephone wire for over half a year now. This was reported 6 months ago (FixMyStreet ref: 7677898). Please get rid of it asap.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Glenarm Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Flytipping outside Nisbet Hall, 2nd December
item.description:
There are two bags of construction / landscaping waste that have been abandoned outside Nisbet Community Hall for about 3 years now. Can they please be removed?

item.title: Large items left on street, 2nd December
item.description:
Every week large items being left on street near electric recycling bins. This then encourages people to dump black refuse sacks full of rubbish there. Large furniture items are taken from bin shed and put out into street. On some occasions the furniture has blocked the fire exit.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Gallions Road, Charlton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Incorrect Use of Right Turn Lanes, 2nd December
item.description:
In both directions on Lavendar Hill at the traffic lights, cars regularly use the right turn lanes to go straight. This causes a lot of competitive driving, especially during busy times. Please do something to enforce lane discipline. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lavender Hill, Clapham Junction, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Smashed glass on the pavement for weeks, 2nd December

item.title: 6 trees ON HAYES LANE LONG THE BOUNDARY OF LANGLEY WOOD, 2nd December
item.description:
There are 6 trees in a row along the boundary of langley wood which are within close promimity of the house. you will be aware the house has suffered structuarl issues duwe to tree roots and we have had a tree root protection barrier installed at consederable cost. it is a condition of our insurance that the trees along are boundary which are the councils responsibility are kept pruned back . i have owned the property for over 20 years and i have never seen these trees being maintained. can you please arrnage for all these trees to be pollarded as a matter of urgency

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayes Lane, Park Langley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
